--- In gladiator@y..., bluedrgnkid@a... wrote:
> You have a point, but what if you had them at level 255? Maybe then 
you could make a ultimate person, not like they can't take out the 
entire game alone anyway.

It's been my experience that it is extremely difficult (if not 
possible) to get a character byeond experience level 250 WITHOUT 
cheating in some form.  The biggest form of cheating I use to reach 
those high experience levels is by giving characters extra health and 
mana during a scenario.  Typically, I'll run out of energy using the 
most powerfull attack available and need lots more to continue the 
fight.

I do have a theory about experience levels and how to potentially 
handle them, but that's a topic for another week.

If you are going for a really high experience levels, you'll have to 
keep your constitution levels low to protect you from faeries and keep 
your dexiteriority levels low (at least until a new release fixes that 
problem) so that you can still use teleporters.  In addition, you'll 
need to watch your intelligence levels and armor levels to keep from 
crashing the game.  I am pretty convinced I have almost completely 
explored the limits of having a team composed of a single extremely 
high experienced level character.
